alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Grady; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 12 at 2:27PM EDT until March 12 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Jackson County in the Panhandle of Florida... Northern Calhoun County in the Panhandle of Florida... Northern Gadsden County in Big Bend of Florida... North central Liberty County in Big Bend of Florida... East central Washington County in the Panhandle of Florida... Decatur County in southwestern Georgia... Southern Grady County in southwestern Georgia... Southern Seminole County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 330 PM EDT/230 PM CDT/. * At 227 PM EDT/127 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Chattahoochee to near Marianna to 12 miles south of Chipley, moving east at 40 to 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Bainbridge, Quincy, Cairo, Marianna, Havana, Whigham, Greensboro, West Bainbridge, Chattahoochee, Sneads, Gretna, Grand Ridge, Altha, Alford, Attapulgus, Climax, Rock Bluff, Ocheesee, Juniper and Douglas City. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT/700 PM CDT/ for Big Bend of and the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT/700 PM CDT/ for Big Bend of and the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia.
